channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19 testing criteria back in question as community tests drop to 8 over weekend
item.description: Just eight people were swabbed for Covid-19 in the community on Sunday, prompting the government to look at whether to loosen testing criteria.

item.title: Environmental cost of Porirua housing plan raises concerns
item.description: A proposal to build 2000 houses over two decades on a rolling hillscape in Porirua is desperately needed, but at what cost to the environment?

item.title: Tolaga Bay farmers 'horrified' by forest slash after heavy rain
item.description: Tairāwhiti locals are preparing for a second storm after a deluge of weekend rain flooded a highway and sent forest slash tumbling towards beaches.

item.title: Whakaari/White Island eruption: Victim's brother hopes tours can resume
item.description: The brother of a man killed in the Whakaari/White Island eruption says he hopes a new warning system will mean tours on the island can resume soon.

item.title: Marlborough 'spectacular' limestone landmark to be protected
item.description: A Marlborough natural landmark will be protected forever, while a lake famed for hosting cricket during dry weather will be protected from stock.

item.title: Staff censured after baby died at Waikato Hospital
item.description: Staff at Waikato Hospital's neonatal intensive care unit have been censured after failing to act fast enough to treat a newborn baby with a brain infection.

item.title: Mataura urges toxic waste's immediate removal by government
item.description: The government is being called on to move potentially toxic waste from a disused Southland paper mill which flooded over the weekend, and exact payment from mining giant Rio Tinto later.

item.title: Lyttelton Port workplace 'bullying' culture under investigation
item.description: An independent review will investigate bullying, racial and sexual discrimination, harassment, and unfair selection of family members for roles.

item.title: Air NZ online credits access: 'We've been ... making sure it's the right product'
item.description: Checkpoint - Air NZ says its credit self-service tool had to be tested thoroughly but it is confident it will work, and help reduce call centre wait times.

item.title: Roads damaged in Northland storm may take years to repair
item.description: It may be years before slip-damaged roads in the Far North are back to normal. The mayor says there are more orange cones than people.

item.title: Steven Wallace shooting case: Police used excessive force, family argues
item.description: Police shots that killed a man in Waitara two decades ago have again been criticised as an excessive use of force.

item.title: Covid-19 update: One new case in managed isolation today
item.description: There is one new case of Covid-19 in managed isolation today, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.

item.title: Tertiary enrolments rise as job opportunities fall
item.description: Victoria University and Manukau Institute of Technology have reported hundreds more mid-year enrolments than normal as job opportunities dry up.

item.title: 'Expect the unexpected': East Coast roads treacherous after flooding
item.description: Roads are still treacherous in the Gisborne and East Coast regions after weekend flooding, and forestry debris has washed onto the beach at Tolaga Bay.

item.title: New alert system would have given warning about Whakaari/White Island eruption
item.description: A new volcano warning system - which would have alerted people to the Whakaari/White Island eruption 16 hours before it happened - is ready to be put to use.

item.title: Northland floods leave homes uninhabitable, farms under water
item.description: As the flood waters recede in Northland the full extent of the damage from the weekend's deluge is becoming clear.

item.title: Child dies after kayak capsizes
item.description: The child was one of three people rescued by helicopter after a kayak capsized off the coast of Miranda in the Waikato.

item.title: Taika Waititi features in anti-racism campaign launched by Human Rights Commission
item.description: The Human Rights Commission is hoping to raise awareness about racism in Aotearoa as it launches a new campaign.
